page.title: 03Newcastle Urban Motorway
page.content: The{Newcastle Inner City Motorway} was completed in 1975 after 13 years of objections. The{Â£20M per mile}was much higher than estimated due to large compensation payments. The original plan for West and East encircling arms round the CBD and an additional Tyne bridge was scrapped. Instead the{East Central}arm runs from the Tyne Bridge, touching the one-way city centre network at key points and linking out on new surface to the{A69, {A1}and the eastward dual carriageway {'Coast Road', A1058.} {Tz land loss}was reduced by putting the N-bound deck over the S-bound, by shaving parks and by using redundant railway yards. It works as a{by-pass,}better still for centre access including{emergency services. The{bridge is a commuter {bottleneck.}
